title: Chest Pain: Cardiac and STEMI
description: Protocol for managing chest pain with cardiac and STEMI assessment, including clear decision pathways for STEMI vs non-STEMI management

details: Aspirin 81 mg x 4 PO (chewed) OR 325 mg PO
Nitroglycerin 0.3/0.4 mg Sublingual - Repeat every 5 minutes x 3 if prescribed to patient and BP ≥ 100

stemi_definition.text: STEMI Definition: ≥ 1 mm ST Segment elevation in ≥ 2 contiguous leads, ≥ 2 mm ST/J point elevation in V2-V3 for men, ≥ 1.5 mm ST/J point elevation in V2-V3 for women, ECG software diagnoses Acute MI (symptomatic)

stemi_transport.text: Transport based on: STEMI - EMS Triage and Destination Plan, Immediate Notification of Facility, Immediate Transmission of ECG if capable, Keep Scene Time to ≤ 15 Minutes

non_pci_center_check.text: If transporting to Non-PCI Center - Reperfusion Checklist

agency_specific_medications_stemi.text: Agency Specific Medications: Thrombolytic, Heparin, Plavix

nitroglycerin_sl.text: Nitroglycerin 0.3/0.4 mg SL - Repeat every 5 minutes as needed

details.morphine: 2-4 mg IV/IO, repeat every 5 minutes as needed, maximum 10 mg
details.fentanyl: 50-75 mcg IV/IO, repeat 25 mcg every 20 minutes as needed, maximum 200 mcg
details.alternative: Use either medication based on protocol and availability

hypotension_shock_protocol.text: Hypotension / Shock Protocol AM-5 if indicated

chf_pulmonary_edema_protocol.text: CHF / Pulmonary Edema Protocol AC-5 if indicated

notify_destination_medical_control.text: Notify Destination or Contact Medical Control
